info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 21 at 6:18PM MDT until July 21 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected in Miles City.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, west central Custer.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated very heavy rain due to thunderstorms, with up to an inch of rain expected in a very short time. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in Miles City. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miles City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING
